review.title: Fuzzy inference system for integrated VVC in isolated power systems
review.abstract: This paper presents a fuzzy inference system for integrated volt/var control (VVC) in distribution substations. The purpose is go forward to automation distribution applying conservation voltage reduction (CVR) in isolated power systems where control capabilities are limited. A fuzzy controller has been designed. Working as an on-line tool, it has been tested under real conditions and it has managed the operation during a whole day in a distribution substation. Within the limits of control capabilities of the system, the controller maintained successfully an acceptable voltage profile, power factor values over 0,98 and it has ostensibly improved the performance given by an optimal power flow based automation system. CVR savings during the test are evaluated and the aim to integrate it in the VVC is presented.

sections.text: This paper presents a Fuzzy Inference System for Integrated Volt / Var Control (VVC) in Distribution Stations, the purpose of which is to automate distribution by applying Conservation Voltage Reduction (CVR) in isolated power supply systems where control options are limited. A Fuzzy Controller has been developed, which has been tested as an online tool under real-world conditions and managed operation for a whole day in a Distribution Station. Within the control capabilities of the system, the controller has successfully maintained an acceptable voltage profile, power factor values above 0.98 and ostensibly improved the performance of an optimal flow-based automation system. CVR savings during the test are evaluated and the goal of integrating them into the VVC is presented. KEYWORDSConservation Voltage Reduction, Distribution Automation, Fuzzy Inference Systems, Isolated Power Systems, Volt / Var Control.

sections.heading: 6. CONCLUSIONS
sections.text: A fuzzy inference system was designed as an online tool to give the proper distribution strategy for capacitor circuits and tap movements to control reactive power / voltage in a distribution station. It has passed all safety issues around power systems and has been tested in a real case under real conditions. It has managed operation in the control center for an entire day for a distribution station in the Canary Islands. Within the limits of the control capabilities of the system, the fuzzy controller has successfully maintained an acceptable and flat voltage profile, whereby the mean deviation was related to the objective value.
